posts.name:
Marcus Parade, 🌞💡✅ MBA
Marcus Parade, 🌞💡✅ MBA
posts.content:
👋🧩 are you climbing the wall alone? 

I find in business and our lifes, walls are everywhere.

Big challenges +
Steep goals +
Tough markets.

The truth is:

No one succeeds alone.

Just like weasels stacking up to climb a wall, teamwork and companionship can take us to new heights. 🛠️

Together, we’re stronger.
Together, we grow.

💡 2 business tips I have for us to embrace teamwork:

1️⃣ Communicate openly:

Share ideas, challenges, and successes. Transparency builds trust.

2️⃣ Celebrate small wins:

Recognize everyone's contributions. Motivation fuels momentum.

Because when we lift each other, no one gets left behind.

Let’s climb higher - together! 🚀

♻️ please share to inspire + grow your network

🫶 follow meif you like for more inspirations

posts.name:
JavaScript
JavaScript
posts.content:
🐛 When Bug Fixing Turns Into Bug Multiplication 🤦‍♂️

Picture this: You’ve been battling The Bug™ for hours. Sleepless nights, 100+ Stack Overflow tabs open, your coffee mug judging you for the refill count… and then, your team leader walks in. 😌

You think, Finally! Help has arrived 👨🏻‍🚒👨🏻‍🔧. The cavalry! The guru of all things code. Surely, the bug doesn’t stand a chance now.
BUT THEN...

Your team leader takes one look at the code, says, “Hmm, let me try something real quick.”
And BAM 💥 not one, not two, but THREE new bugs magically appear.
“Oh, uh… gotta run to a meeting. Good luck!” 😳

And just like that, you’re left staring at a disaster zone. Your single bug is now a family of bugs, thriving and happy in your code. 🐞🐛

Moral of the story ? Sometimes the best help is no help at all. 😂

Developers, have you ever had a “helpful” intervention turn into bug chaos ? Share your stories below, et’s laugh through the pain together!

posts.name:
The Corporate Bhakt ™️
The Corporate Bhakt ™️
posts.content:
Radhika Gupta, Edelweiss clarified that while hard work is non-negotiable for success, it must be sustainable. “Hard work is not equal to hours worked. Many of those hours in entry-level careers were pure facetime. Hard work needs to be sustainable for us to do it long enough for compounding to kick in.”

She criticized inefficiencies in workplace culture that reward appearances over output. “Many developed nations work 8–4 but ensure those hours are productive. Come in on time, bring your best, and use technology to be effective,” she wrote, citing her team’s use of AI to reduce grunt work.

via

posts.name:
Startup Pedia
Startup Pedia
posts.content:
On Thursday, the National Restaurant Association of India (NRAI) strongly opposed the leading restaurant aggregators Zomato and Swiggy entering private-label food delivery through their quick-commerce platforms.

The NRAI charged Zomato and Swiggy with leveraging their dominant market positions and access to restaurant data to introduce private-label food products directly or through subsidiaries like Blinkit Bistro and Swiggy Cafe/SNACC.

“Zomato and Swiggy, originally established as marketplace platforms, are now leveraging their dominant positions and access to restaurant data to venture into private-label food delivery either directly or via their subsidiary,” the NRAI disclosed, adding that it raises legal concerns under the Copyright Act and associated laws.

“This strategy not only cannibalises the business of restaurants that rely on these platforms but also raises serious concerns under the Copyright Act and related laws,” the association added.

NRAI President and Wow Momo! CEO Sagar Daryani said disapprovingly, “We were always given verbal assurances by the aggregators that they would never resort to private labelling. This is a breach of trust.”

Moreover, he pointed out the issue of consumer masking, stressing that restaurants do not have access to customer data collected by the aggregators.

The NRAI, representing over five lakh restaurants in India, stated that this move breaches marketplace neutrality and impairs fair competition, creating a significant threat to the survival of restaurants nationwide.

The industry body further noted that Zomato and Swiggy exploited data derived from restaurant partners while launching competing products, creating a conflict of interest.

Daryani affirmed that the NRAI is “absolutely not okay” with this development, declaring the industry body would seek legal remedies while approaching regulatory authorities.

With the restaurant industry valued at Rs 5.69 lakh crore, the NRAI has urged restaurants, customers and regulators to work together and maintain ethical practices in the competitive food delivery space.

posts.name:
Pratyay Banerjee
Pratyay Banerjee
posts.content: TaskUs TaskUs (formerly heloo powered by TaskUs) Indoor has laid off more than 300 employees, leaving hundreds of families in distress. This decision highlights a disturbing trend where profits are prioritized over people. Employees are the backbone of any organization, and treating them as expendable undermines their immense contribution to a company’s success. Did the management consider the families who depend on these employees? In a country like India, where social security is minimal, such actions leave people vulnerable, with no safety net to fall back on. The government must step in immediately to address this issue and hold companies accountable for the well-being of their workforce. Organizations must realize that their true strength lies in their employees, not just in profits. It's time to put people first.

posts.name:
Dr. Manan Vora
Dr. Manan Vora
posts.content:
If you ended 2024 with unclaimed office leaves, you’re endangering your mental health.

See, there are 2 kinds of employees.

1. Those who take advantage of every leave in their HR policy (this is 90% of people).

2. Those who think they’ll impress their boss and take as few leaves as possible.

If you’re in the 2nd category, I’m here to tell you that you’re doing it all wrong.

Firstly, most Indian companies give the bare minimum leave allowance - the least you need for your mental health.

And skipping even those leaves doesn’t make you a better employee. It makes you a more exhausted one.

As a doctor, I’ve seen how chronic stress manifests in patients:

- Insomnia
- Fatigue
- Burnout

The human body isn’t designed for constant output.

And mental reset grants you superpowers like:

- 40% more creativity
- A stronger immune system
- Higher emotional resilience
- And a higher life expectancy

So please, don’t make the same mistake in 2025.

Block those leaves. Plan a trip. Or just stay home and sleep in.

Because when you take care of yourself, you’re not ‘slacking off’ — you’re investing in your long-term health, happiness, AND productivity.

So it’s good for your mind, body and career.

Found this impactful? Repost to help your connections too.

posts.name:
Bryce P.
Bryce P.
posts.content:
Taking the first step is a challenge. But staying consistent and moving forward with confidence can be forgotten.

That’s where the real work begins and where true growth happens.

We often talk about staying the course and taking that initial leap.

But honestly sometimes decisiveness is the hardest part.

Staying focused and keeping a clear mind on your plan.

While continuing to move forward with confidence, isn’t always easy.

Decisions come fast, especially in the heat of the moment.

It’s far too easy to lose sight of your direction.

But the thing is, with practice, mistakes will happen.

Those mistakes are your best learning opportunities.

Stay the course.

Keep moving forward.

Confidence and consistency.

Progress will follow.

posts.content:
♥️🌟♥️🌟♥️Magic Happens When Skills Meet Passion ❤️🌟♥️🌟♥️

👉In the ever-changing world of careers, true transformation occurs when your skills align with your passion. This is when work stops feeling like work and starts to feel like a calling, unlocking both personal and professional fulfilment.

🔥Here’s how combining your skills with your passion creates magic:

💖 Motivation: Passion drives high motivation, pushing you to excel, leading to greater productivity and genuine enthusiasm for your work.

♥️ Learning: When you love what you do, your curiosity and desire to improve soar. You’ll seek new knowledge, stay ahead in your field, and embrace lifelong learning.

🌹 Performance: Skills fueled by passion result in excellence. Your dedication and enjoyment lead to better quality work, attention to detail, and innovative solutions, making you a standout in your profession

🎀 Resilience: Passionate individuals are more resilient. The love for your work helps you face challenges with a positive attitude, turning obstacles into opportunities for growth🛑

♥️ Connections: Passion attracts like-minded individuals, fostering valuable collaborations, mentorships, and support systems, enhancing your professional network❣️

🌟Experience the magic that happens when your skills meet your passion. This powerful combination not only propels your career forward but also brings joy and fulfilment to your professional journey.✨

posts.name:
Aman Sharief
Aman Sharief
posts.content:
𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗘𝗻𝗱 𝗨𝘀𝗲𝗿'𝘀 𝗔𝘁𝘁𝗮𝗰𝗸 - 𝗬𝗼𝘂 𝗖𝗮𝗻’𝘁 𝗠𝗶𝘀𝘀! 🤣 

Imagine it was a 𝗽𝗲𝗮𝗰𝗲𝗳𝘂𝗹 𝗙𝗿𝗶𝗱𝗮𝘆 𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗻𝗶𝗻𝗴 and a brand-new Junior SAP consultant - 𝗠𝗶𝗿𝗮𝗻𝗱𝗮 was just about to wrap up his day and head into the weekend.

The office was quiet, and he was feeling pretty good about getting out on time.

Suddenly, with a dramatic slam, the 𝗼𝗳𝗳𝗶𝗰𝗲 𝗱𝗼𝗼𝗿 𝗯𝘂𝗿𝘀𝘁 𝗼𝗽𝗲𝗻 with a loud bang, and in walked the end user - 𝗕𝗿𝗲𝗻𝗱𝗮, looking angry like she was about to blow a fuse, and waving her arms.😡

"𝗧𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝘀𝘆𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗺 𝗶𝘀 𝗮 𝘁𝗼𝘁𝗮𝗹 𝗺𝗲𝘀𝘀!" she shouted, her voice echoing through the office like an 𝗳𝗶𝗿𝗲 𝗮𝗹𝗮𝗿𝗺.

Miranda who was new and still a bit nervous felt his heart race and his 𝗵𝗮𝗻𝗱𝘀 𝘀𝘄𝗲𝗮𝘁. He tried to respond, but his voice trembled. 😅

Just then, imaging 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝗮𝘀 𝗮 𝗦𝗲𝗻𝗶𝗼𝗿 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘀𝘂𝗹𝘁𝗮𝗻𝘁 walked in as a 𝗦𝗮𝘃𝗶𝗼𝘂𝗿 to your junior and saved his Weekend 🤣

posts.name:
Analytics / Data Science / AI Career
Analytics / Data Science / AI Career
posts.content:
𝗢𝗻𝗲 𝗼𝗳 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗺𝗼𝘀𝘁 𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗺𝗼𝗻 𝗺𝗶𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗸𝗲𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝟵𝟬% 𝗼𝗳 𝗱𝗮𝘁𝗮 𝘀𝗰𝗶𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗶𝘀𝘁𝘀 

make (and only 10% catch in time) is data leakage.

𝐃𝐚𝐭𝐚 𝐥𝐞𝐚𝐤𝐚𝐠𝐞 𝐭𝐲𝐩𝐢𝐜𝐚𝐥𝐥𝐲 𝐨𝐜𝐜𝐮𝐫𝐬 𝐝𝐮𝐞 𝐭𝐨:
↳ Copy-pasting code without understanding it
↳ Scaling features before splitting the data
↳ Including target variables in the feature set
↳ Using future data in feature engineering
↳ Shuffling data in time series cross-validation
↳ Imputing missing values with data from the future

... and the list can go on.

Almost every data scientist has fallen into this trap at some point.

However, detecting data leakage early is a crucial skill to avoid disastrous outcomes.

𝐇𝐞𝐫𝐞 𝐚𝐫𝐞 𝐚 𝐟𝐞𝐰 𝐬𝐢𝐠𝐧𝐬 𝐨𝐟 𝐝𝐚𝐭𝐚 𝐥𝐞𝐚𝐤𝐚𝐠𝐞:
↳ If you notice unstable predictions in production
↳ If your model performs unusually well on the test set
↳ If your data science lead points it out (seriously, this happens more often than you'd think!)

𝐑𝐞𝐦𝐞𝐦𝐛𝐞𝐫: "Proper model validation is the best way to prevent leakage."

𝐄𝐧𝐫𝐨𝐥𝐥 𝐍𝐨𝐰 𝐈𝐧 𝐎𝐮𝐫 𝐀𝐈 & 𝐌𝐚𝐜𝐡𝐢𝐧𝐞 𝐋𝐞𝐚𝐫𝐧𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐂𝐞𝐫𝐭𝐢𝐟𝐢𝐜𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐂𝐨𝐮𝐫𝐬𝐞:-

♻️ Share this with your network to show your commitment to tackling real-world ML challenges!

posts.name:
Sai Ram Somanaboina
Sai Ram Somanaboina
posts.content:
I don’t hire developers by looking at how green their GitHub graph is and here’s why…

A greener GitHub contribution graph doesn’t mean higher skills or deeper expertise.

Let me tell you why:

1. Many teams use private repositories like Bitbucket or internal tools. Everything is mostly private. If they could show those commits, their graph would be green every day.

2. Students and junior developers often use GitHub to showcase their projects, challenges, or learning milestones.

That’s great, but it doesn’t automatically mean they’re “better” than someone with a gray graph who’s been solving real-world problems for years.

3. git commits can be backdated or faked. A few commands and your GitHub can look like you’ve been coding non-stop for years. Does that show skill? No.

4.A graph won’t tell me how you debug tough issues, work with a team, or handle edge cases in production.

What actually matters to me?

- Your problem-solving skills. Can you write clean, maintainable, and scalable code?
- Your mindset. Are you curious and eager to learn?
- Your collaboration. Can you work with others to build great software?
- Your impact. Do you understand the "why" behind what you're building?

Green graphs are cool to look at, but they’re not the full story.

And developers, if your GitHub isn’t “green enough,” don’t let that hold you back.

Focus on building great things, public or private.

What do you think? Do green graphs matter in hiring? Let me know below!

posts.content:
𝗖𝗵𝗲𝗰𝗸 𝗼𝘂𝘁 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗔𝗜-𝗴𝗲𝗻𝗲𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗲𝗱 𝗰𝗮𝘁 𝘃𝗶𝗱𝗲𝗼! 🐱
𝗦𝗼 𝘀𝗮𝘁𝗶𝘀𝗳𝘆𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘁𝗼 𝘄𝗮𝘁𝗰𝗵🎥


AI is transforming marketing, proving that even marketing can be fun, engaging, and innovative.

Here's how :

1️⃣ 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝗖𝗿𝗲𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼n: AI can generate videos, images, and even written content, saving time and enabling teams to focus on strategy.
2️⃣𝗣𝗲𝗿𝘀𝗼𝗻𝗮𝗹𝗶𝘇𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻: AI analyses user behaviour to deliver tailored recommendations and experiences, increasing engagement and conversion rates.
3️⃣𝗣𝗿𝗲𝗱𝗶𝗰𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗲 𝗔𝗻𝗮𝗹𝘆𝘁𝗶𝗰𝘀: AI-driven insights help marketers anticipate trends and make data-driven decisions for better ROI.
4️⃣𝗔𝘂𝘁𝗼𝗺𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻: AI tools streamline repetitive tasks like email campaigns, ad placement, and A/B testing, boosting efficiency.
5️⃣𝗘𝗻𝗵𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲𝗱 𝗖𝗿𝗲𝗮𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗶𝘁𝘆: AI unlocks new possibilities for creativity, like generating unique visuals, videos, or interactive experiences.

This cat video is more than just fun content—it’s a demonstration of AI’s power to captivate audiences and drive meaningful engagement.
